question: Where is the headquarters of the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development (NABARD) located?
solution:
• NABARD's headquarters is located in Mumbai, Maharashtra, specifically at Bandra-Kurla Complex.
  • It was established on 12 July 1982 under the National Bank for Agriculture and Rural Development Act, 1981.
  • NABARD is the apex development financial institution in India responsible for credit planning, policy formation, and rural development financing.
  • It regulates and refinances Regional Rural Banks (RRBs) and Cooperative Banks, and manages funds like the Rural Infrastructure Development Fund (RIDF).
  • Recent Update (2025): NABARD sanctioned ₹4,613 crore for 485 rural infrastructure projects in Arunachal Pradesh, focusing on climate-resilient farming, digitisation, and rural connectivity.
  • It also partnered with SBI to finance ₹500 crore in FY 2025–26, aiming to scale up to ₹1,000 crore annually for rural growth.
  • NABARD celebrated its 44th Foundation Day, reaffirming its mission toward self-reliant rural economies and inclusive growth.

question: Which of the following is the apex body for coordinating scientific research in India?
option_1: Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO)
option_2: Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR)
option_3: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO)
option_4: Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC)
solution:
• Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) is the apex body for coordinating scientific and industrial research in India.
  • Established in 1942, CSIR operates under the Ministry of Science and Technology.
  • It oversees a network of 37 national laboratories and is involved in multidisciplinary R&D across aerospace, biotechnology, chemicals, energy, and environmental sciences.
  • CSIR is known for innovations like indigenous COVID-19 testing kits, drug development, and green technologies.
  • In 2025, CSIR launched a new initiative to promote AI-driven research in climate resilience and sustainable agriculture, aligning with India’s SDG goals.
  • Other organizations like ISRO, DRDO, and BARC focus on space, defense, and nuclear research, respectively, but CSIR coordinates broad-spectrum scientific research across sectors.

question: The Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) was established under which act?
option_1: Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992
option_3: Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934
solution:
• SEBI was established as a statutory body under the Securities and Exchange Board of India Act, 1992.
  • Initially set up in 1988 as a non-statutory body by a Government resolution, it gained statutory powers in 1992 through this Act.
  • SEBI regulates the securities market, protects investor interests, and ensures fair practices among market participants.
  • It oversees entities like stock exchanges, brokers, mutual funds, and portfolio managers.
  • In 2025, SEBI introduced new guidelines to enhance AI-based surveillance systems for detecting insider trading and market manipulation.
  • It also launched a Green Bond Framework to promote sustainable finance and transparency in ESG investments.

question: Reserve Bank of India (RBI) was established on which date and where is its headquarters located?
solution:
• Reserve Bank of India (RBI) was established on 1 April 1935 under the Reserve Bank of India Act, 1934.
  • Its headquarters is located in Mumbai, Maharashtra and it was shifted there permanently in
  • Sanjay Malhotra is the current Governor of RBI (as of Aug 2025).
  • RBI is called the “Bank of Banks” because it:
    • Maintains current accounts and reserves of all scheduled banks.
    • Provides liquidity support and acts as the lender of last resort.
    • Facilitates inter-bank transactions and clearing settlements.
  • RBI manages inflation through monetary policy tools like:
    • Repo Rate: Increasing it makes borrowing costlier, reducing demand and controlling inflation.
    • Reverse Repo Rate, CRR, SLR, and Open Market Operations to regulate money supply.
    • It targets Consumer Price Index (CPI) inflation within a band of 2%–6%, with a central target of 4%.
  • In 2025, RBI revised its inflation forecast to 3.1% for FY26, the lowest in six years.
  • It maintained the repo rate at 5.50%, signaling a cautious stance amid global trade risks.
  • RBI also launched AI-driven surveillance systems and promoted green finance through updated frameworks.

question: Where is the Headquarter of ISRO located?
solution:
• The Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) is headquartered in Bengaluru, Karnataka, at Antariksh Bhavan, New BEL Road.
  • ISRO was formed in 1969, evolving from the earlier INCOSPAR initiative led by Dr. Vikram Sarabhai, the father of India’s space program.
  • It operates under the Department of Space, which is directly overseen by the Prime Minister of India.
  • ISRO is responsible for satellite development, launch vehicles, interplanetary missions, and space-based applications.
  • As of August 2025, the current Chairman of ISRO is Dr. V. Narayanan, who assumed office on 14 January 2025, succeeding S. Somanath.
  • Dr. Narayanan is a distinguished scientist known for his work on cryogenic propulsion systems and was previously the Director of the Liquid Propulsion Systems Centre (LPSC).
  • In 2025, ISRO successfully launched the NASA-ISRO Synthetic Aperture Radar (NISAR) mission and is preparing for the Gaganyaan human spaceflight and a 6,500 kg U.S.-built communication satellite.

question: Which organization is responsible for atomic energy research in India?
solution:
• Bhabha Atomic Research Centre (BARC) is the premier nuclear research facility in India, responsible for atomic energy research and development.
  • It operates under the Department of Atomic Energy (DAE), which was established in 1954 and functions directly under the Prime Minister’s Office.
  • BARC was originally known as the Atomic Energy Establishment, Trombay, and was renamed in 1966 in honor of Dr. Homi J. Bhabha, the father of India’s nuclear program.
  • It conducts research in nuclear power, radiation technologies, reactor design, fuel reprocessing, and waste management.
  • BARC also supports non-power applications like medical isotopes, food irradiation, and environmental monitoring.
  • In 2025, BARC expanded its work on thorium-based reactor technology and radioisotope production for cancer treatment, aligning with India’s strategic and healthcare goals.

question: When was the Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO) established?
solution:
• DRDO was established in 1958 by merging the Defence Science Organisation, Technical Development Establishments of the Indian Army, and the Directorate of Technical Development & Production.
  • It functions under the Ministry of Defence, Government of India, and is headquartered at DRDO Bhawan, New Delhi.
  • DRDO is India’s premier military R&D agency, responsible for developing technologies in missiles, aeronautics, electronics, combat vehicles, naval systems, and life sciences.
  • Its motto is “Balasya Moolam Vigyanam” (Strength’s Origin is in Science).
  • As of 2025, Dr. Samir V. Kamat is the Chairman of DRDO, leading over 40 laboratories across India.
  • DRDO celebrated its 67th Foundation Day on 1 January 2025, marking new milestones in hypersonic systems, AI-based warfare, and indigenous radar development.

question: The headquarters of the Food Corporation of India (FCI) is located in which city?
solution:
• The Food Corporation of India (FCI) is headquartered in New Delhi, located at Barakhamba Lane.
  • FCI was established on 14 January 1965 under the Food Corporations Act, 1964, to implement India’s National Food Policy.
  • Its primary functions include procurement, storage, transportation, and distribution of food grains, ensuring food security across the country.
  • FCI operates through five zonal offices and 26 regional offices, managing one of the largest supply chains in Asia.
  • Initially, its headquarters was in Chennai, but it was later shifted to New Delhi for better coordination with central ministries.
  • In 2025, FCI signed a performance MoU with the Ministry of Consumer Affairs to enhance efficiency in procurement and smart warehousing solutions.

question: The headquarters of the Small Industries Development Bank of India (SIDBI) is located in which city?
solution:
• SIDBI's headquarters is located in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh.
  • It was established on 2 April 1990 under an Act of Parliament as a wholly owned subsidiary of IDBI, later delinked in March 2000.
  • SIDBI is the apex financial institution for the Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises (MSME) sector in India.
  • It operates under the Ministry of Finance, Government of India, and is one of the five All India Financial Institutions regulated by the Reserve Bank of India.
  • SIDBI plays a key role in refinancing, direct lending, and development of MSMEs, and also supports initiatives like Startup India and Make in India.

question: The headquarters of the Indian Grassland and Fodder Research Institute (IGFRI) is located in which city?
solution:
• IGFRI is headquartered in Jhansi, Uttar Pradesh, and was established in 1962 as a premier institute under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).
  • It is dedicated to basic, strategic, and applied research in forage production, grassland management, and fodder utilization, supporting sustainable livestock development.
  • The institute plays a key role in technology development, training, and extension services for farmers, agri-businesses, and government bodies.
  • IGFRI has three regional research stations located in Dharwad (humid tropics), Avikanagar (semi-arid/arid), and Srinagar/Palampur (temperate zones) to address location-specific forage needs.
  • Its research divisions include Crop Improvement, Crop Production, Grassland & Silvipasture Management, and Plant-Animal Relationship, making it a South Asia leader in forage R&D.

question: Which national organization has its headquarters located in Anand, Gujarat?
option_2: National Dairy Development Board
option_3: Indian Council of Agricultural Research
option_4: Central Institute for Research on Goats
solution:
• The National Dairy Development Board (NDDB) is headquartered in Anand, Gujarat.
  • It was founded in 1965 by Dr. Verghese Kurien, known as the “Father of the White Revolution” and “Milkman of India”, who revolutionized India’s dairy sector through Operation Flood.
  • NDDB promotes dairy cooperatives, supports milk production, processing, and marketing, and empowers rural farmers.
  • It operates under the Ministry of Fisheries, Animal Husbandry and Dairying, Government of India.
  • Other options:
    • National Horticulture Board– Headquartered in Gurugram, Haryana.
    • Indian Council of Agricultural Research – Headquartered in New Delhi.
    • Central Institute for Research on Goats – Located in Makhdoom, Farah, District Mathura, Uttar Pradesh.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Drug Research Institute (CDRI) located?
solution:
• The Central Drug Research Institute (CDRI) is headquartered in Lucknow, Uttar Pradesh.
  • It was established in 1951 and inaugurated by Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru at the historic Chattar Manzil complex, making it one of India’s first post-independence research laboratories.
  • CDRI is a premier institute under the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), functioning under the Ministry of Science and Technology.
  • It specializes in drug discovery, development, and biomedical research, with divisions in pharmacology, toxicology, cancer biology, neuroscience, and more.
  • CDRI has contributed to the development of several indigenous drugs like Centchroman (Saheli) and Arteether (E-mal).

question: Where is the headquarters of the National Dairy Research Institute (NDRI) located?
solution:
• The National Dairy Research Institute (NDRI) is headquartered in Karnal, Haryana.
  • Originally established in 1923 as the Imperial Institute of Animal Husbandry and Dairying in Bangalore, it was shifted to Karnal in 1955 and renamed NDRI.
  • It is a premier institute under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) and was granted Deemed University status in 1989.
  • NDRI specializes in dairy production, processing, extension, and education, offering B.Tech, M.Tech, and Ph.D. programs in dairy science.
  • The institute has contributed significantly to milk yield improvement, indigenous breed conservation, and dairy technology innovations.
  • Regional stations:
    • Southern Regional Station – Bengaluru
    • Eastern Regional Station – Kalyani, West Bengal
  • Campus size: 1,384 acres, making it one of the largest dairy research campuses in Asia.

question: Where is the headquarters of the National Atlas & Thematic Mapping Organisation (NATMO) located?
solution:
• The National Atlas & Thematic Mapping Organisation (NATMO) is headquartered at Rashtriya Atlas Bhavan, GN Block, Sector V, Salt Lake, Kolkata – 700091.
  • Originally established in 1956 as the National Atlas Organisation (NAO), it was renamed NATMO in 1978 to reflect its expanded role in thematic cartography and geographical research.
  • The organization was founded under the leadership of Professor S.P. Chatterjee, a pioneer in Indian geography, with approval from Prime Minister Jawaharlal Nehru.
  • NATMO functions under the Department of Science & Technology, Government of India, and is responsible for producing the National Atlas of India, thematic maps, and geospatial data for planning and development.
  • It also supports digital mapping, GIS, remote sensing, and cartography for the visually impaired, making it a key player in India’s National Geospatial Policy.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Indian Institute of Vegetable Research (IIVR) located?
solution:
• The Indian Institute of Vegetable Research (IIVR) is headquartered in Varanasi, Uttar Pradesh.
  • It was originally part of the All India Coordinated Research Project (AICRP) on vegetable crops at IARI, New Delhi, established in 1971.
  • In 1986, it was elevated to the Project Directorate of Vegetable Research, and in 1992, the headquarters was shifted to Varanasi.
  • In 1999, it was renamed as IIVR and granted the status of a national institute under ICAR.
  • IIVR focuses on crop improvement, production, protection, and seed technology for vegetables, supporting nutritional security and sustainable agriculture.
  • The institute operates a 150-acre research farm, advanced laboratories, gene banks, and training centers.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Indian Bureau of Mines (IBM) located?
solution:
• The Indian Bureau of Mines (IBM) is headquartered at Indira Bhavan, Civil Lines, Nagpur, Maharashtra – 440001.
  • It was established in 1948 under the Ministry of Mines, Government of India, to promote scientific development, conservation of mineral resources, and environmental protection in mining.
  • IBM is a multi-disciplinary organization with six technical divisions, including mineral processing, mining research, and ore dressing.
  • It operates 3 Zonal Offices, 12 Regional Offices, and 2 Sub-Regional Offices, along with pilot plants and laboratories across India.
  • IBM does not regulate coal, petroleum, atomic minerals, or minor minerals, focusing instead on non-coal major minerals.
  • A Modern Mineral Processing Laboratory and Pilot Plant was established in Nagpur with support from the United Nations Development Programme (UNDP).

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Rice Research Institute (CRRI) located?
solution:
• The Central Rice Research Institute (CRRI) is headquartered in Bidyadharpur, Cuttack, Odisha, and was established on 23 April 1946.
  • It was founded by Dr. K. Ramiah, a renowned rice breeder, with support from the Government of Odisha, which provided 60 hectares of experimental farmland.
  • CRRI is now known as the ICAR–National Rice Research Institute (NRRI) and functions under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).
  • It is a premier institute for rice research in South Asia, focusing on crop improvement, pest and disease management, agronomy, and climate-resilient technologies.
  • NRRI contributes to food security, sustainable rice farming, and supports national programs like Krishi Vigyan Kendras (KVKs) in multiple states.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Sugarcane Research Institute located?
solution:
• The Central Sugarcane Research Institute is officially known as the ICAR–Sugarcane Breeding Institute (SBI).
  • It is located in Coimbatore, Tamil Nadu, and was established in 1912 under the Madras Presidency during British rule.
  • SBI is affiliated with the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) and is the oldest and only dedicated sugarcane breeding institute in India.
  • It has contributed to the development of Co varieties, which are cultivated in over 28 countries and cover more than 90% of India’s sugarcane area.
  • The institute also operates regional centers in Karnal (Haryana), Kannur (Kerala), and Agali (Kerala).
  • It plays a key role in hybridization, molecular breeding, disease resistance, and climate-resilient sugarcane technologies.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Institute for Arid Horticulture located?
solution:
• The Central Institute for Arid Horticulture (CIAH) is located in Beechwal, Bikaner, Rajasthan, along National Highway 15.
  • It was established in 1993 under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) to promote horticultural development in arid and semi-arid regions.
  • The institute specializes in fruit, vegetable, and medicinal plant research suited to dry climates, including crops like ber, pomegranate, aonla, and khejri.
  • CIAH plays a vital role in developing drought-resistant varieties, water-efficient technologies, and training farmers in arid zone horticulture.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Forest Research Institute located?
solution:
• The Central Forest Research Institute is officially known as the Forest Research Institute (FRI), located in Dehradun, Uttarakhand.
  • Originally established as the Imperial Forest Research Institute in 1906, it is one of the oldest forestry research institutions in the world.
  • FRI operates under the Indian Council of Forestry Research and Education (ICFRE) and was declared a Deemed University in 1991.
  • The institute is spread over 450 hectares, with a majestic Greco-Roman style building once listed in the Guinness Book of Records as the largest purely brick structure.
  • It offers Master’s and Ph.D. programs in forestry and conducts research in areas like forest ecology, silviculture, climate change, and biodiversity conservation.
  • FRI also hosts the Indira Gandhi National Forest Academy (IGNFA), which trains officers for the Indian Forest Service (IFS).

question: Where is the headquarters of the Indian Cancer Research Institute located?
solution:
• The Indian Cancer Research Institute is officially known as the Cancer Research Institute (CRI), located in Mumbai, Maharashtra.
  • It was originally established as the Indian Cancer Research Centre (ICRC) in 1952, under the leadership of Prof. V.R. Khanolkar, a pioneering medical scientist.
  • In 1966, the ICRC was merged with the Tata Memorial Hospital (TMH) to form the Tata Memorial Centre (TMC), India’s first comprehensive cancer care and research institution.
  • TMC functions under the Department of Atomic Energy, Government of India, and includes advanced facilities like ACTREC (Advanced Centre for Treatment, Research and Education in Cancer) in Navi Mumbai.
  • CRI focuses on basic and translational cancer research, including molecular biology, immunology, chemotherapy, and genetic engineering, and offers Ph.D. programs in life sciences.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Institute of Agricultural Engineering (CIAE) located?
solution:
• The Central Institute of Agricultural Engineering (CIAE) is located in Bhopal, Madhya Pradesh, and was established on 15 February 1976.
  • It functions as an autonomous institute under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR), Ministry of Agriculture & Farmers’ Welfare.
  • CIAE is a premier center for research, development, and training in agricultural engineering, focusing on areas like farm machinery, post-harvest technology, energy in agriculture, irrigation, and agro-industrial extension.
  • The institute also collaborates with state agricultural universities and international agencies to develop location-specific technologies and provide policy inputs for agricultural mechanization.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Mining Research Institute located?
solution:
• The Central Mining Research Institute (CMRI) was originally established in Dhanbad, Jharkhand, in 1946.
  • In 2007, CMRI merged with the Central Fuel Research Institute (CFRI) to form the CSIR–Central Institute of Mining and Fuel Research (CIMFR).
  • CIMFR is a constituent laboratory of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR), under the Government of India.
  • It provides R&D support across the coal-energy chain, including exploration, mining, safety, environmental sustainability, and fuel utilization technologies.
  • The institute operates from two campuses in Dhanbad: Barwa Road and Digwadih, and is strategically located in the Damodar coal belt, known as the coal capital of India.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Leather Research Institute (CLRI) located?
solution:
• The Central Leather Research Institute (CLRI) is located in Adyar, Chennai, Tamil Nadu, and was established on 24 April 1948.
  • It is a constituent laboratory of the Council of Scientific and Industrial Research (CSIR) and is recognized as the world’s largest leather research institute in terms of research output and patents.
  • CLRI was founded as part of India’s post-independence industrialization drive, with support from the Madras State, which provided 75 acres of land.
  • The institute conducts R&D in leather processing, environmental control, product design, and footwear technology, and collaborates with NIFT and other national bodies.
  • CLRI also developed the Indian Footwear Sizing System (IFSS) in 2023, based on data from over 1 lakh foot scans across 70+ districts.
  • It has regional centers in Kanpur, Kolkata, Jalandhar, and Ahmedabad, supporting leather clusters across India.

question: Where is the headquarters of the National Housing Bank (NHB) located?
solution:
• The National Housing Bank (NHB) is headquartered at Core 5-A, India Habitat Centre, Lodhi Road, New Delhi – 110003.
  • NHB was established on 9 July 1988 under the National Housing Bank Act, 1987, following the announcement in the Union Budget 1987–88.
  • It was set up as the apex financial institution for housing finance in India and is now under the Ministry of Finance, Government of India.
  • NHB regulates and refinances Housing Finance Companies (HFCs) and supports housing development through policy guidance, financial assistance, and market regulation.
  • Since the Finance Act of 2019, regulatory powers over HFCs have been transferred to the Reserve Bank of India, while NHB continues its developmental role.

question: When was the Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) established?
solution:
• The Central Board of Direct Taxes (CBDT) was formally established on 1 January 1964 under Section 3 of the Central Board of Revenue Act, 1963.
  • It was created by bifurcating the Central Board of Revenue (established in 1924) into two separate boards:
    • CBDT for direct taxes
    • CBEC (now CBIC) for indirect taxes
  • CBDT functions as a statutory authority under the Department of Revenue, Ministry of Finance, Government of India.
  • It oversees the formulation and implementation of policies related to direct taxes, including income tax, corporate tax, and formerly wealth tax.
  • The board comprises a Chairperson and six Members, each handling key domains like legislation, administration, audit, taxpayer services, and systems.

question: When was the National Institution for Transforming India (NITI Aayog) established?
solution:
• The National Institution for Transforming India (NITI Aayog) was established on 1 January 2015 by a resolution of the Union Cabinet, replacing the Planning Commission.
  • It was created to promote cooperative federalism, bottom-up planning, and strategic policy formulation aligned with India’s development goals.
  • The Chairman of NITI Aayog is the Prime Minister of India, currently Shri Narendra Modi.
  • The Vice Chairman is Suman Bery, an economist and policy expert.
  • As of 2025, NITI Aayog consists of the following members:
    • Chairperson: Prime Minister of India
    • Vice Chairperson: Appointed by the PM
    • Full-Time Members: 4 domain experts (e.g., economics, health, agriculture)
    • Ex-Officio Members: Up to 4 Union Ministers nominated by the PM
    • Chief Executive Officer (CEO): Currently B.V.R. Subrahmanyam, IAS
    • Special Invitees: Experts and practitioners (recently expanded to 11)
    • Governing Council: Chief Ministers of all States, Lt. Governors of UTs
    • Regional Councils: Formed for specific issues, chaired by PM or nominee
  • NITI Aayog leads key initiatives like Atal Innovation Mission, SDG India Index, and Aspirational Districts Programme, and plays a central role in Viksit Bharat @2047 vision.

question: Where is the headquarters of the Central Research Institute for Dryland Agriculture (CRIDA) located?
solution:
• The Central Research Institute for Dryland Agriculture (CRIDA) is located in Santoshnagar, Hyderabad, Telangana, and was established in 1985 as an independent institute under the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR).
  • It evolved from the All India Coordinated Research Project for Dryland Agriculture, which began in 1971 to address the challenges of farming in low-rainfall regions.
  • CRIDA serves as the national nodal agency for dryland and rainfed agriculture, focusing on climate-resilient technologies, agrometeorology, natural resource management, and policy support.
  • It coordinates major programs like NICRA (National Innovations in Climate Resilient Agriculture) and AICRPDA (All India Coordinated Research Project on Dryland Agriculture).
  • The institute has received multiple accolades, including the ICAR Best Research Institute Award, and plays a key role in national and international collaborations.

question: When was the Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) established?
solution:
• The Steel Authority of India Limited (SAIL) was officially incorporated on 24 January 1973.
  • It was formed as a holding company to manage India’s major steel plants, following a policy statement presented to Parliament on 2 December 1972.
  • SAIL took over the management of five integrated steel plants: Bhilai, Bokaro, Durgapur, Rourkela, and Burnpur, along with Salem Steel Plant and Alloy Steel Plant.
  • It traces its roots to Hindustan Steel Limited, established on 19 January 1954, which managed early steel plants like Rourkela, Bhilai, and Durgapur.
  • In 1978, SAIL was restructured into an operating company, and today it is a Maharatna CPSE under the Ministry of Steel, Government of India.
  • Headquarters: New Delhi, India.

question: Where is the headquarters of the National Academy of Agricultural Research Management (NAARM) located?
solution:
• The National Academy of Agricultural Research Management (NAARM) is headquartered in Rajendranagar, Hyderabad, Telangana – 500030.
  • It was established in 1976 by the Indian Council of Agricultural Research (ICAR) to build leadership and management capacity in agricultural research and education.
  • NAARM offers specialized programs in agricultural research management, human resource development, agribusiness management, and policy planning.
  • It conducts PGDM-ABM (Post Graduate Diploma in Management – Agribusiness Management), training for ICAR scientists, and hosts MOOCs on emerging topics like AI in agriculture.
  • NAARM is also home to the Centre of Lifelong Learning in Agricultural Education (COLLAgE) and supports innovation through startup incubation and IP management.
  • The academy is ranked among India’s top institutions for agricultural management education, and is approved by ICAR and AICTE.
